title: Do double taxation treaties increase foreign direct investment to developing countries?

references.title: Asymmetric FDI and Tax-Treaty Bargaining: Theory and Evidence,
references.raw: Chisik, R. and Davies, R.B., 2004, Asymmetric FDI and Tax-Treaty Bargaining: Theory and Evidence, Journal of Public Economics, 88, 1119-1148.

references.title: Boon or bane? Reassessing the productivity of foreign direct investment.
references.raw: De Soysa, I., and Oneal, J.R., 1999, Boon or bane? Reassessing the productivity of foreign direct investment. American Sociological Review, 64, 766-782.

references.title: Chains of Ownership, Regional Tax Competition, and Foreign Direct Investment. Working Paper 9224.
references.raw: Desai, M.A., Foley, C.F. and J.R. Hines Jr., 2002, Chains of Ownership, Regional Tax Competition, and Foreign Direct Investment. Working Paper 9224. Cambridge, MA: National Bureau of Economic Research.

references.title: Corporate, Domicile and Average Effective Tax Rates: The Cases
references.raw: 25 Collins, J.H. and Shackelford, D.A., 1995, Corporate, Domicile and Average Effective Tax Rates: The Cases of Canada, Japan, the United Kingdom, and the United States, International Tax and Public Finance, 2, 55-84.

references.title: Do Bilateral Tax Treaties Promote Foreign Direct Investment? Working Paper No. 8834. Boston (Mass.): National Bureau of Economic Research. Also published
references.raw: Blonigen, B.A. and R.B. Davies, 2002, Do Bilateral Tax Treaties Promote Foreign Direct Investment? Working Paper No. 8834. Boston (Mass.): National Bureau of Economic Research. Also published in E.K. Choi and J.C. Hartigan (eds.), 2005, Handbook of International Trade Volume II, 526-546. London: Blackwell.

references.title: Do U.S. Multinationals Face Different Tax Burden than Other Companies? Working Paper.
references.raw: Collins, J.H. and Shackelford, D.A., 2002, Do U.S. Multinationals Face Different Tax Burden than Other Companies? Working Paper. University of North Carolina.

references.title: Do We Still Need Tax Treaties?.
references.raw: Easson, A., 2000, Do We Still Need Tax Treaties?. Bulletin for International Fiscal Documentation, 54, 619-625.

references.title: EC Regional Trade Agreements. Brussels: European Union Directorate General Trade.
references.raw: EU, 2004, EC Regional Trade Agreements. Brussels: European Union Directorate General Trade. http://europa.eu.int/comm/trade/index_en.htm

references.title: Income Distribution, Political Instability, and Investment.
references.raw: Alesina, A. and Perotti, R., 1996, Income Distribution, Political Instability, and Investment. European Economic Review, 40, 1203-1228.

references.title: Regression Diagnostics.
references.raw: Belsley, D.A., Kuh, E., and Welsch, R.E., 1980, Regression Diagnostics. New York: John Wiley.

references.title: Tax Treaties and Foreign Direct Investment: Potential versus Performance.
references.raw: Davies, R.B., 2004, Tax Treaties and Foreign Direct Investment: Potential versus Performance. International Tax and Public Finance, 11, 775-802.

references.title: Tax Treaties and Tax Avoidance: the 2003 Revisions to the Commentary to the OECD Model.
references.raw: Arnold, B., 2004, Tax Treaties and Tax Avoidance: the 2003 Revisions to the Commentary to the OECD Model. Bulletin for International Fiscal Documentation, 58, 244-260.

references.title: The Changing Geography of Foreign Direct Investment, In N. Kumar (Ed.): Globalization, Foreign Direct Investment and Technology Transfers: Impacts on and prospects for developing countries.
references.raw: Dunning, J.H., 1998, The Changing Geography of Foreign Direct Investment, In N. Kumar (Ed.): Globalization, Foreign Direct Investment and Technology Transfers: Impacts on and prospects for developing countries. New York: Routledge.

references.title: The Determinants of Foreign Direct Investment: Sensitivity Analyses of Cross-Country Regressions,
references.raw: Chakrabarti, A, 2001, The Determinants of Foreign Direct Investment: Sensitivity Analyses of Cross-Country Regressions, Kyklos, 54, 89-114.

references.title: The Effects of Bilateral Tax Treaties on U.S.
references.raw: Blonigen, B.A. and Davies, R.B., 2004, The Effects of Bilateral Tax Treaties on U.S. FDI Activity. International Tax and Public Finance, 11, 601-622.

references.title: The Impact of Endogenous Tax Treaties on Foreign Direct Investment: Theory and Empirical 26 Evidence. Working Paper.
references.raw: Egger, P., M. Larch, M. Pfaffermayer and H. Winner, 2004. The Impact of Endogenous Tax Treaties on Foreign Direct Investment: Theory and Empirical 26 Evidence. Working Paper. University of Innsbruck, Department of Economics and Statistics.

references.title: The Tax Treaties Myth.
references.raw: Dagan, T., 1999, The Tax Treaties Myth. New York University Journal of International Law and Policy, 32, 939-996.

references.title: What Drives Capital Flows? The Case of Cross-Border M&A Activity and Financial Deepening.
references.raw: Di Giovanni, J., 2005, What Drives Capital Flows? The Case of Cross-Border M&A Activity and Financial Deepening. Journal of International Economics, 65, 127-149.
